titleNullable: IGN's Best Game of All Time (2021)
subtitleNullable: A bracket competition decided by public vote
descriptionNullable:
## Context
In September of 2021, IGN started a bracket competition on 64 games picked by their influence and public opinion, not exactly by IGN's opinion, since some of the titles are not present on their top 64. The results were decided by public vote, with 26,604,825 votes registered. The competition raised a lot of discussion on the internet, questioning if the results of some matches were fair, or if you should consider other games on the list to participate in the competition.

## Content
This dataset is composed of 4 features:

**Game**: Game arbitrally used as reference in match.
**Opponent**: Game's opponent in match.
**Ratio**: Game's percentage of votes in matches.
**Win**: If the game won or not.

More features can be added to the analysis with the help of other datasets, such as Video Games Sales 2019, Steam Store Games (Clean dataset), Metacritic all time games stats, etc.

## Further Reading
[IGN's ‘Best Game Ever’ poll is exactly what you'd expect.](https://www.inputmag.com/gaming/igns-best-game-ever-poll-is-exactly-what-youd-expect)
[IGN's 'Best Video Game Of All Time' Tournament Is Getting WILD.](https://www.nintendolife.com/news/2021/09/random_igns_best_video_game_of_all_time_tournament_is_getting_wild)
[God of War Is the Winner of IGN’s Best Video Game of All Time Bracket.](https://www.ign.com/articles/ign-best-video-game-of-all-time-bracket-vote-finale-results-winners-god-of-war)
